data.title: Crean Lutheran High School
data.text:
October 28 Mission and Vision Statements are drafted by Dave Velasquez and Rob Warren. They are adopted by the Governing Board.

The Class of 2021 also featured 74 members of the National Honor Society (NHS), 174 members of the California Scholarship Federation (CSF), and boasted a scholarship average of $35,000 per student. 96% of the Class of 2021 went to a college or university.

Crean Lutheran launched the Law Cohort with 15 students enrolled. The Law Cohort provides a launch point for students interested in pursuing careers in law, elected office, and/or government.

Crean Lutheran students and their teachers were successfully able to continue their studies online during the mandated quarantine period due to the 2020 COVID-19 pandemic.

The Worship Team and Dance Department filmed the Praise Night with Music and Dance. During the premiere of the Virtual Night of Praise, donations were taken for the OC Rescue Mission.

The Choral, Dance, and Instrumental departments came together for the Christmas on the Green performance.

The Class of 2022 also featured 45 members of the National Honor Society (NHS), 129 members of the California Scholarship Federation (CSF), and boasted a scholarship average of $46,000 per student. 98% of the Class of 2022 went to a college or university.

28 students, 4 chaperones, and 3 parent volunteers returned to El Salvador to serve with Sus Hijos, an organization serving orphaned and foster care children in San Salvador and the surrounding areas.

41 students and 8 chaperones returned to Mexico to serve with Baja Christian Ministries, building a house for a family in Girasoles, Mexico.

The Class of 2023 also featured 40 members of the National Honor Society (NHS), 176 members of the California Scholarship Federation (CSF), and boasted a scholarship average of $42,000 per student. 99% of the Class of 2023 went to a college or university.

Windy City Choral Festival in Chicago, Illinois. Mixed (SATB) choirs joined together to sing in one of the world’s great concert halls – Orchestra Hall at Symphony Center.

Boston Instrumental Festival in Boston, Massachusetts. Students performed in the Boston Symphony Hall, where the Boston Symphony Orchestra performs. The hall was designated a U.S. National Historic Landmark in 1999. Symphony Hall remains, acoustically, among the top three concert halls in the world and is considered the finest facility in the United States. Dr. Elliott Bark composed an original piece The Last Battle featuring Grammy Award Winning Trumpeter Terry Everson.

38 students, 6 chaperones returned to El Salvador to serve with Sus Hijos, an organization serving orphaned and foster care children in San Salvador and the surrounding areas.
